title: undefined reference to `_Unwind_Resume'
body:
I am using Windows7, Mingw64, gcc is 
`gcc.exe (x86_64-posix-sjlj-rev0, Built by MinGW-W64 project) 8.1.0`
rustc is 1.51.0
```
$ rustup show
Default host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
rustup home:  C:\Users\tiina\.rustup

installed toolchains
--------------------

stable-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu (default)
stable-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc

active toolchain
----------------

stable-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu (default)
rustc 1.51.0 (2fd73fabe 2021-03-23)
```
The issue is, when rustc compiles, it generates 32 `.o` files, but gcc is 64. So linker results in error.  
If I use 32 gcc, the link error is gone. I don't understand why rustc compiles with 32. I didn't have a ~/.cargo/config, and I even tried `cargo build --target=x86_64-pc-windows-gnu --verbose`. And I used 64 rustup_init.exe to install rust. 

